availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Miller (Bath County, Kentucky, copper & tin smith and jailor)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, copper and tin smith and jailer. Kentucky native. Married to Missouri Lee Hornback Miller in Bath County in June 1847. Father of Alberta Miller and Fannie Miller. Tinsmith in Bath County in 1850. Copper and tin smith in Bath County in 1860. Jailer in Bath County in 1862. Jailer in Bath County in August 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Division 2, p. 3A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 7.
"Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954," database with images, FamilySearch (https://www.familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:V5ZH-F2T : 16 January 2021), Film # 000273005, image 602, Bath County Marriages, accessed January 27, 2021.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1862,” in 1863 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 24 (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1863), 298-306.
KYR-0002-060-0011.
